page.title: 06The Gamekeeper
page.content:
Mr. Ward is a{Gamekeeper. }He has partridges and pheasants. A pheasant {lays her eggs}and he goes out and takes them. He puts them in an {incubator and they hatch. } He has to keep the chicks warm or they will die.
Then he puts them in a wood. He goes to bed at 10 o'clock and gets up at 5 o'clock. He then has to clean out the{filters}and check the {heaters. } The price of an egg is 48 pence, a chick is 72 pence and a full grown hen is Â£3. The {enemies }of the birds are buzzards, foxes, mink and wild cats. If the hen lays 17 eggs about 3 would live in nature. He feeds them seed and water.
